<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 415, 390, 431]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 446, 785, 461]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 462, 320, 476]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 478, 504, 492]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 494, 504, 508]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 509, 380, 523]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 538, 907, 567]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions in the space provided. If additional space is required, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet. The question number(s) must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 568, 907, 597]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 598, 600, 612]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 613, 606, 627]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 642, 608, 657]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 658, 755, 673]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 674, 440, 688]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 919, 125]]<|/det|>
In a statistics lesson 12 people were asked to think of a number, \(x\), between 1 and 20 inclusive. From the results Tom found that \(\Sigma x = 186\) and that the standard deviation of \(x\) is 4.5. Assuming that Tom's calculations are correct, find the values of \(\Sigma (x - 10)\) and \(\Sigma (x - 10)^2\). [3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 138, 920, 920]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 75, 910, 92]]<|/det|>
Andy has 4 red socks and 8 black socks in his drawer. He takes 2 socks at random from his drawer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 107, 156, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 107, 670, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that the socks taken are of different colours.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 107, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 138, 920, 357]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 412, 544, 429]]<|/det|>
Draw up the probability distribution table for \(X\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 412, 920, 429]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 75, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
The distance that car tyres of a certain make can travel before they need to be replaced has a normal distribution. A survey of a large number of these tyres found that the probability of this distance being more than \(36 800 \mathrm{km}\) is \(0.0082\) and the probability of this distance being more than \(31 000 \mathrm{km}\) is \(0.6915\). Find the mean and standard deviation of the distribution. [5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 153, 920, 922]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 149, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 75, 920, 91]]<|/det|>
The random variable \(X\) has the distribution \(\mathrm{N}(\mu , \sigma^2)\), where \(3\sigma = 4\mu\) and \(\mu \neq 0\). Find \(\mathrm{P}(X < 3\mu)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 91, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 123, 920, 922]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 510, 92]]<|/det|>
In Pelmerdon \(22\%\) of families own a dishwasher.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 107, 156, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 107, 918, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that, of 15 families chosen at random from Pelmerdon, between 4 and 6 inclusive own a dishwasher. [3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 153, 918, 920]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 75, 154, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 75, 918, 108]]<|/det|>
A random sample of 145 families from Pelmerdon is chosen. Use a suitable approximation to find the probability that more than 26 families own a dishwasher. [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 919, 138]]<|/det|>
Vehicles approaching a certain road junction from town \(A\) can either turn left, turn right or go straight on. Over time it has been noted that of the vehicles approaching this particular junction from town \(A\), \(55\%\) turn left, \(15\%\) turn right and \(30\%\) go straight on. The direction a vehicle takes at the junction is independent of the direction any other vehicle takes at the junction.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 153, 154, 170]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 153, 918, 185]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that, of the next three vehicles approaching the junction from town \(A\), one goes straight on and the other two either both turn left or both turn right. [4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 198, 920, 912]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 154, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 918, 107]]<|/det|>
Three vehicles approach the junction from town \(A\). Given that all three drivers choose the same direction at the junction, find the probability that they all go straight on. [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[78, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 918, 108]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 122, 156, 140]]<|/det|>
